name: Prairie Wheat Berry Salad
description: Wheat berries, well-known in the Prairies, make a delicious twist to an ordinary salad.
preparation:
1. Cook wheat berries in a large pot of boiling salted water for about 1 hour, until tender. Drain.
  2. Meanwhile, whisk oil with balsamic vinegar, Sweet & Spicy Mustard, Sea Salt and Pepper. Drizzle over warm wheat berries
  3. Add spinach and corn, and toss to mix.
tips:
Serving Suggestion: Serve with grilled fish.

Chef Tip: Wheat berries are actually wheat kernels (not including the hull), and are light to reddish brown in colour. When cooked, wheat berries have a slightly chewy texture and a nutty flavour. If you canâ€™t find them, substitute with farro or a mix of brown and wild rice.
